thread.title: AGL Energy profit tumbles as writedowns, acquisition costs weigh | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The
thread.title_full: AGL Energy profit tumbles as writedowns, acquisition costs weigh | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: Michael Roddan
title: AGL Energy profit tumbles as writedowns, acquisition costs weigh | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The
text:
AGL Energy has revealed its net profit plunged more than half in the past financial year due to the cost of acquisitions and writedowns.
But the group’s underlying earnings increase were buoyed by its Macquarie Generation takeover.
AGL’s net profit fell 61.8 per cent to $218 million in the year to June, compared with $570 million the previous year.
Underlying profit rose 12.1 per cent to $630 million, compared with $562 million a year earlier.
The underlying result strips out the $117 million cost of AGL’s Macquarie Generation acquisition and a $435 million writedown on its upstream gas assets.
Revenue inched up 2.2 per cent to $10.68 billion.
AGL managing director Andy Vesey said the Macquarie Generation takeover had been a significant driver of improvements in profit and operational cash flow, more than offsetting the effect of removal of the carbon tax.
AGL will pay a final fully-franked dividend of 34c a share, an increase of 1c a share.
Originally published as AGL profit tumbles on buyout costs, writedowns
